title: US Cities Geography game
description: Geography game to learn about US cities

San Francisco.name: San Francisco
San Francisco.description: San Francisco, officially the City and County of San Francisco, is the cultural, commercial, and financial center of Northern California

tidbits: the Frommer's travel guide describes it as possibly the most beautiful, certainly the most photographed, bridge in the world
one of the most iconic bridges in the United States, and has been called one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World
if you untangled all of its cables, they would stretch around the world 3 times
developed with facilities for a lighthouse, a military fortification, a military prison
it had a federal prison from 1934 to 1963
during its 29 years of operation, the penitentiary claimed that no prisoner successfully escaped
the street is famous for a steep, one-block section with eight hairpin turns.
the famous one-block section, claimed to be "the crookedest street in the world"
famous for sea lions.
where you can take a cruise to under a famous bridge.
world's last manually operated cable car system.

New York City.name: New York City
New York City.description: The City of New York, often called New York City or simply New York, is the most populous city in the United States

tidbits: the copper statue, a gift from the people of France to the people of the United States.
a hybrid cable-stayed/suspension bridge and is one of the oldest roadway bridges in the United States.
sprawling park with pedestrian paths & ballfields, plus a zoo, carousel, boat rentals & a reservoir.
one of the world's busiest pedestrian areas, it is sometimes referred to as "The Crossroads of the World".

Washington, D.C..name: Washington, D.C.
Washington, D.C..description: Washington, D.C., formally the District of Columbia and commonly referred to as Washington or D.C., is the capital of the United States of America
nicknames: The Capital of the Free World

tidbits: official residence and workplace of the President of the United States.
a long, grassy area that is home to iconic monuments including the Lincoln Memorial and the Washington Monument.
home of the United States Congress, and the seat of the legislative branch of the U.S. federal government.
an obelisk on the National Mall, built to commemorate George Washington, the first President of the United States.
a group of museums and research centers administered by the Government of the United States.

Los Angeles.name: Los Angeles
Los Angeles.description: Los Angeles is the cultural, financial, and commercial center of Southern California.

tidbits: an iconic amusement park with rides, shows & costumed characters.
it comprises more than 2,600 five-pointed terrazzo and brass stars embedded in the sidewalks along 15 blocks of Hollywood Boulevard
ice Age–fossil excavation site with an adjacent museum, plus a re-created prehistoric garden.
a public observatory which offers a planetarium, exhibits, public telescopes, and the best views of the Los Angeles basin.

nicknames: The City of the Big Shoulders
